title: It’s clear “who the bad guys are”
summary: Is honoring the dead really a political statement? Jessica Tarlov and Aaron Parnas react to the disqualification of a Ukrainian athlete from the Winter Olympics, on Raging Moderates.
transcript_html:
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/shorts/QmFvL-lR4dk

Transcript

the Ukrainian skeleton racer who was disqualified from the Winter Olympics after refusing to remove a helmet honoring 24 of the 500 plus Ukrainian athletes killed in the war. Violation of the IOC's rules on political statements. Um I was really bummed. I always am bummed when stuff like this happens, especially when it's so black and white as to who the good guys and the bad guys are. and it doesn't seem like a political statement to honor people who have been killed. Um, but do you think it's a bad move for the Olympics to

legislate on something like this? >> I don't get how the Olympics can say that this is a bad political statement or whatnot when they banned Russia from competing. Is that not the same thing? Like the Olympics did that, right? Like they banned Russia. They said that you can't compete under a Russian flag. And so when a Ukrainian wants to support those who died at the hands of the Russian government, like come on. >> Come on.
